NeEDS4BigData

The R package “NeEDS4BigData” holds subsampling methods that can be implemented over big data.

How did the name “NeEDS4BigData” came through ?

New Experimental Design based Subsampling methods for Big Data.

How to engage with “NeEDS4BigData” the first time ? 

## Installing the package from GitHub
devtools::install_github("Amalan-ConStat/NeEDS4BigData")

## Installing the package from CRAN
install.packages("NeEDS4BigData")

What does “NeEDS4BigData” ?

Algorithms are implemented under Generalised Linear Models (GLMs) for big data to obtain informative subsamples.

Subsampling Methods

  1. A- and L-optimality based subsampling for GLMs.
  2. A-optimality based subsampling for Gaussian Linear Models.
  3. Leverage sampling for GLMs.
  4. Local case control sampling for logistic regression.
  5. A-optimality based subsampling under measurement constraints for GLMs.
  6. Model Robust subsampling method for GLMs.
  7. Subsampling method for GLMs when the model is potentially misspecified.

To explain these methods in detail 4 articles are written and they are,

  1. Introduction - explains the need for subsampling methods.
  2. Linear Regression - implementing subsampling methods for linear regression under 3 scenarios.
  3. Logistic Regression - implementing subsampling methods for logistic regression under 3 scenarios.
  4. Poisson Regression - implementing subsampling methods for Poisson regression under 3 scenarios.

The 3 scenarios mentioned above are,

  1. First scenario - we assume the main effects can explicitly describe the big data.
  2. Second scenario - we assume a set of models can appropriately describe the big data.
  3. Third scenario - we the main effects model is potentially misspecified.
